alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 4:26PM CDT until June 14 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT/730 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Henry. In southwest Georgia, Clay. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT /730 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 PM CDT /526 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Abbeville Municipal A/P, Screamer, Willis Crossroads, Graball, Lawrenceville, Scottsboro Crossroads, Murphy Station, Double Bridges, Thomas Mill Creek, Otho, Shorterville, Hardwickburg, Coates, Walter F George Lake, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Capps, Standleys Store and Edwin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
